member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Diagnostics.ProcessExtensionMethod
member.summary: Process extension methods.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Diagnostics.ProcessExtensionMethod.CanStart(System.Diagnostics.Process)
member.summary: Verifies if a previous instance of the process is already running.
member.param: The process on which to check for previous instances.
member.returns: True if it is ok to keep the process running or false if the process should exit.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Diagnostics.ProcessExtensionMethod.CanStart(System.Diagnostics.Process,System.Int32)
member.summary: Verifies if previous instances of the process are already running.
member.param: The process on which to check for previous instances.
member.returns: True if it is ok to keep the process running or false if the process should exit.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Diagnostics.ProcessExtensionMethod.CanStart(System.Diagnostics.Process,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Exit the current process if previous ones are already running.
member.param: The process on which to check for previous instances.
Whether to kill or not the current process if result is false.
member.returns: True if it is ok to keep the process running or false if the process should exit.

member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.Factory`1
member.summary: Specific Factory for the given entity. Creates the instance with the configuration received from the FactoryProvider.
member.typeparam: The type of entity to instantiate.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.Configure
member.summary: This method requires SectionName to be a valid ConfigurationSection name in the configuration file. It searches this section and attempts to store it as the property Configuration.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.Configure(System.Object)
member.summary: Stores the ConfigurationSection provided in the property Configuration, and executes abstract method DoConfigure(), in case any child factories need to take action with the configuration.
member.param: ConfigurationSection corresponding to the entity to instantiate.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.Configure(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the abstract method DeserializeConfiguration, expecting child factories to return a valid ConfigurationSection, wich should be the entity instance configuration required.
member.param: The raw XML of the configuration for the entity instance.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.DoConfigure
member.summary: Allows child factories to take action on Configuration received.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.DeserializeConfiguration(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the raw XML of the configuration for the entity instance into a valid ConfigurationSection
member.param: The raw XML of the configuration section.
member.returns: A ConfigurationSection corresponding to the entity to instantiate.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.SectionName
member.summary: If section name is provided. The factory will attempt to obtain the given section by its name, and store it as the property Configuration.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.ConfigurationProvider
member.summary: Devuelve el objeto Configuration que es donde se obtuvo la configuración de la instancia actual

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryBase.Configuration
member.summary: The configuration section corresponding to the entity to instantiate. If any.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.IFactory`1.Create
member.summary: Creates a new instance of TEntity based on the configuration provided.
member.returns: The appropiate TEntity instance with the configuration applied.

member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration
member.summary: This class represents and processes FactoryProvider configurations. Containing the type of factory to create, if it should be Singleton or not, and the section [optional] to search for the entity to instantiate configuration. If no section is provided the configuration is expected to be contained inside this FactoryProvider configuration.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.DeserializeElement(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Standard .Net method for ConfigurationElement deserealization. Maps this class properties with the Xml configuration file.
member.param: Provided by the Framework. Contains the raw Xml of the configuration.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.SerializeToXmlElement(System.Xml.XmlWriter,System.String)
member.summary: Standard .Net method for ConfigurationElement deserealization. Maps this class properties with the Xml configuration file.
member.param: Provided by the Framework, writes the properties of this configuration to the Xml file
Provided by the Framework, allows for a override of the element name of this configuration.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.InstanceConfiguration
member.summary: If no section name is provided, this property will contain the raw XML with what should be the configuration required for the entity instance.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.FactoryType
member.summary: Type (as Full Name) of the Factory to create.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.IsSingleton
member.summary: Should this factory be treated as a Singleton.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryConfiguration.SectionName
member.summary: If SectionName is provided, FactoryProvider will search for this section in order to send this configuration to the Factory that will create the entity instance.

member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryProvider
member.summary: Main Factory class. Generates Factories for any given entity using the configuration specified. FactoryProvider internally stores all Factories created as Singleton.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryProvider.CreateEntity(System.String)
member.summary: Obtiene el factory de nombre factoryName e invoca al create por reflection evitando el casteo, ya que no se conoce el tipo de la entidad a crear

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryProvider.Instance
member.summary: Singleton accesor to FactoryProvider.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryProvider.Configurations
member.summary: A Dictionary with all the configurations stored in this factory. Each configuration is created and stored the first time it's read. Even if different instances of the same Factory are required, configurations are reused.

member.name: P:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.FactoryProvider.Factories
member.summary: A dictionary containing the list of factories created. If a factory is requested as Singleton, this dictionary stores such a factory. If a factory of the same type is then requested to the FactoryProvider, it will return the instance stored in this dictionary.

member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.InstanceBuilder

member.summary: Creates a proxy to the TEntity published in the Url provided in the configuration.

member.summary: Stores the configuration as a RemotingConfiguration for ease of use.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Factory.RemotingFactory`1.Create
member.summary: Creates the proxy. Prior to creating the proxy, if FileName was provided in the configuration the RemotingConfiguration.Configure is called with the FileName as parameter. Otherwise the same method is called, with AppDomain.CurrentDomain.SetupInformation.ConfigurationFile as parameter.
member.returns: The proxy instance corresponding to the object published in the given Url

member.summary: Compares two files by size.

member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Text.NamedFormatter
member.summary: An extension to the String.Format. It replaces the index based placeholder with named placeholders. Basically you give to this function a format string just like the one you give to String.Format but like this "{Name}, {LastName}. Age {Age:d2}". Then it will complete the data calling the properties of an object (in the previous example, you should pass to the function an object with a Name, LastName Age property.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Text.NamedFormatter.#ctor(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Constructor for a named formmater.
member.param: The string template. In the form of (example) "{Name}, {LastName}. Age {Age:d2}".
The type of the object to use further on to replace the template.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Text.NamedFormatter.Format(System.Object)
member.summary: Formats the template given in the constructor with the given object data.
member.param: The object to use as data source.

member.name: T:Tenaris.Library.System.Text.StringExtensions
member.summary: Named formatter StringExtensions methods.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Text.StringExtensions.Inject(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Encapsulate the use of NamedFormatter.Format. Just pass to the function the format and the object used as data source and it will replace the format string with the data in the object.
member.param: The object to use as data source.
If true, the template will be cached to speed up (significantly) further calls.

member.name: M:Tenaris.Library.System.Text.StringExtensions.Inject(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Encapsulate the use of NamedFormatter.Format. Just pass to the function the format and the object used as data source and it will replace the format string with the data in the object. It will cache all the type info necessary to speed up further calls to this method.
member.param: The object to use as data source.
